column1: 135kph beaten outside off. What a beauty first up, good length, fourth stump across him and no swing and it zipped past the edge
shorter length, he drops it at his feet on the leg side and they hustle through for a quick one
leg stump, 134kph, he clips this neatly behind square on the leg side and fine leg has to come around, an easy two for Finch
135kph, good length, fifth stump line, no swing evident, he shoulders arms and lets this pass. Good carry to the keeper
134kph, good length, hint of shape away and again he leaves this alone
136kph, back of a length, off stump line, he stands up and defends on the back foot to cover
134kph, shorter and angling across, he's squared up completely defending towards point
137kph, good length angling across, he defends on the front foot to mid off
136kph, beaten fending at one that nips away off the seam outside off stump! Stuck on the crease, that seamed and bounced
135kph, much shorter, he's standing up and punching off the back foot to cover
good length, middle and off, he's defending on the front foot
135kph, fuller on middle, he pushes a ball on the front foot mid on
140kph, great length, off stump, hint of swing away, he presses forward and defends firmly back to the bowler
139kph, back of a length, quick feet, he's back and working to the gap in midwicket for one, good batting

edged and caught behind! This was almost a half-volley, across the left-hander, Head's feet were stuck in cement on the crease as threw the hands at a drive and got a thin edge through to de Kock and he gleefully accepts the simple catch. Great start for the great Dale Steyn.
142kph, back of a length across the left hander and he leaves awkwardly as it flees to the keeper

edged and what a catch by du Plessis at second slip! Another full ball across the left hander, he launches into a drive, again not a big forward stride, thick edge, flies high to the skipper's left and he jumps and takes a superb catch flying up with two hands above his left shoulder! Great bowling and catching from South Africa.
onto the pads, 138kph, he clips this away nicely through midwicket, timed well enough to get a couple
137kph, wide of the crease, back of a length, angling back into the right hander, he shoulders arms and it flies through to the keeper
back of a length, 138kph, angled into off, he's forward and defending, it hits the sticker of the bat hard
132kph, back of a length, a touch shorter, he's pressing forward and defending into the off side
137kph, way wide of off stump, sixth stump line, he leaves this well alone
136kph, good length, angled in from wide of the crease, it hits the seam and nips away and flies to the keeper as Finch leaves
138kph, fuller at off stump, he's forward and defending off the inside half of the bat that runs away to square leg
138kph, good length outswinger, he fends from the crease away into the gully
139kph, good length, middle stump, he's squared up a touch on the front foot defending
138kph, good length, fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot with soft hands
138kph, beats him with a cracking outswinger! Wow, what a delivery, good length, swings away, he fends and misses.
138kph, similar line and length and Lynn wisely lets it go outside off
138kph back of a length outside off, he pushes from the crease to backward point
angled into leg stump and he tucks this behind square nicely
137kph, fuller length, off stump line, he drives nicely to mid off
132kph, back of a length wide of off, he's rising on his toes and defending into the off side
139kph, booming attempted drive and miss from Finch. This was wide but not a half-volley, extra bounce flies past the flashing blade

LBW! Finch walks off. No review! This was a good length wide of off, nipped back sharply and hits above the knee roll, and Aleem Dar gives it! He was on his toes on the crease. There is a lot of bounce in this track. Hawkeye had it going over the stumps! How did they not review that! There has been a lot of pace and bounce. That's an error from Australia
138kph, short into the hip and he defends into midwicket
beaten again sparring outside off! Another pure outswinger that zips away past the edge
driven firmly to cover and Klaasen makes a great diving save to his right! He timed that so well but no run
138kph, back of a length, wide of off, he runs this away off the open blade through the vacant gully to third man
full and square driven nicely through cover-point with control, he didn't throw the hands too hard at it
137kph, good length, middle and off, he defends awkwardly from the crease back to the bowler
138kph back of a length, defended towards backward point
138kph, good length, off stump line, he defends on the front foot
138kph, beaten by one that seams away from a length across the left hander who just prods forward at it
138kph, good length, across him again and he lets this one go to the keeper this time
138kph, short ball, he sways under it as it flies to de Kock who mis-gloves it, it wobbled at him and came off his fingers away for a bye
back of a length outside off, he's defending and it hits the sticker of the bat hard
139kph full toss, into middle and he works this cautiously wide of mid but times it well enough for a couple
good length across the left hander, well wide and he leaves this alone
142kph good length across him wide of off and he leaves alone again
good length well wide and across him and he leaves alone again
half-volley 142kph, he drives hard but straight to cover
shorter length, outside off, plenty of bounce, he sways underneath it
139kph, over-pitched and again he drives nicely through cover-point, lovely timing and it doesn't make the rope at the very large square boundary
142kph, good length outside off, and he leaves this through to the keeper
140kph, back of a length, nipping back a touch but it's outside off and bouncing, he leaves on length and it flies through to the keeper
140kph, good length, across the left hander and nipping away, he leaves again to the keeper
good length angling back in and he defends off the thick inside edge onto pad
good length, this takes off from a length, but again he leaves on length and it flies through to the keeper
fuller, outside off, he drives but off a thick inside half of the bat it rolls straight of mid on and they pinch one
beats him with a beauty that nips away from a length past the edge
126kph, back of a length, gets some extra bounce which Carey rides and defends on the back foot into the off side
fuller length, 135kph, he tries to drive but mistimes it, dragging it to mid on
135kph, back of a length into the hip and it hits the thigh pad hard as he tried to work it away
136kph, short into the ribs and he tucks this away to square leg
good length, middle stump line, he defends towards mid on
good length outside off, he leaves this decisively through to the keeper
136kph, middle and off, he defends from the crease on the front foot to backward point with an open face
139kph, fuller length outside off, he drives firmly to mid off but picks out the fielder
140kph, good length, fourth stump, he defends firmly on the front foot to cover
137kph, this takes off and flies from a length, beats him as he fends from the crease and the keeper takes it above his head
full toss and driven down straight of mid on and the crowd cheers as it just gets to the rope! First boundary for Australia, finally!
136kph, back of a length off stump line, and he leaves on length, nicely done, no danger with the extra bounce as the ball flies way over the stumps
138kph, good length, fourth stump line, and again he leaves on line this time watching it go past
129kph, shorter length, angled in and seaming away, he rides the bounce with soft hands and runs it through the vacant gully for one
this cuts him half! 135kph! This nipped off the seam, back between bat and body, it knifed him in half, de Kock was horizontal to his left but couldn't glove it cleanly
angled in, full, inside edge as he drives, thick and well away from leg stump but it runs away for one
138kph, very full, driven straight to the man at mid off
good length angled into off, he defends on the front foot and it hits the sticker of the bat hard
139kph, good length, well wide, he leaves, it wobbles again to de Kock and he takes it awkwardly
135kph, good length angled into off, he pushes off the inside half of the bat through midwicket
138kph, cuts him in half again, beating the inside edge! Wow, another cracker from a length nipping back past the inside edge
fuller length outside off, driven firmly to mid off
138kph, good length, a very late leave on length as it passes over off stump
around the wicket, 129kph, hint of swing in, fuller, he drives off the inside half of the bat through a vacant midwicket
126kph, good length, off stump, he defends on the front foot to cover
back of a length, 128kph wide of off, he's back and running this with a late cut towards third man
123kph, short and wide and cut hard to the man sweeping at deep cover-point
127kph, good length on off, he's forward and playing a rock solid defensive stroke
128kph, good length, fourth stump line, he pushes firmly on the front foot to cover
136kph, back of a length, he drives from the crease to cover-point who is inside the circle
smashed through cover-point! This was shorter and wider and he stands with a solid base and a trademark slash through the field and it races away
back of a length, off stump line, he defends from the crease with the full face into the off side
137kph, good length, fourth stump, he pushes on the front foot and places this through cover-point
137kph, good length, across the left-hander and he leaves
135kph, good length outside off, he leaves this alone as it flies to the keeper
full at off stump from over the wicket, defended to mid-off

another one goes! Appeal for caught behind, given not out and South Africa review straightaway. It sounded like a bottom edge. A delivery with some width, Lynn went after it, and there's a clear noise as the ball passes the bat. There's also a spike on Snicko. Lynn is almost off the field...he's basically walked! Umpire says there's conclusive evidence of an edge. Good, low catch by de Kock. He's gone!
off the mark first ball with a boundary, but good job he hit that! Walked right across his stumps to a length delivery and tickles it to fine leg
full at middle and off, pushed into midwicket
round the wicket, good length at off stump, Carey defends coming forward
this one beats the outside as Carey feels a little away from his body at a length delivery with a hint of movement
back on it first ball, beats the edge as Maxwell is flat-footed as he plays away from his body
extra bounce this time! Back of a length, takes the splice of the bat as Maxwell whips his bottom hand away and fends it around the corner

round the wicket, short outside off, cut hard square of the wicket and there's an excellent stop by Markram as he dives at point. The throw at the non-striker's stumps clips one of the zing bails and it doesn't fall off! (Batsman was well home)
touch too full this time and put away straight down the ground with a lovely straight drive
full at the stumps, strongly punched to mid-off
ouch! That has spat at Maxwell from short of a length and hammered his bottom thumb. He's in some pain here. Vicious delivery

caught at mid-on! It goes from bad to worse for Australia, although Maxwell is standing his ground to see if it's carried. He came forward into a drive, a bit early on it, couldn't keep the ball down. It's dripping on the way Klaasen. Soft signal was out, and third umpire says he's happy the fingers are under the ball
slips this down the leg side and it's called wide

been given caught behind, a wonderful diving catch from de Kock but Stoinis has reviewed. It's been given for the catch, rather than lbw the umpire says. That appears quite a long way from the inside edge as it nips back off the seam, and is outside the line for lbw. So he'll survive. Not a great on-field decision there. That's what DRS is for, though
full, slips into the pads, clipped off his toes through square leg...Australia reach fifty
full outside off, strides forward and drives to deep cover
round the wicket, nips back of the seam and takes an inside edge into his leg
good length outside off, takes a thick outside edge along the ground wide of third slip
round the wicket, short of a length, still some seam movement as this comes off the thigh pad towards gully
beats the edge with another ripper, in the channel outside off, just back of a length
edged, but short of the slips, bisects second and third as they each dive across, runs down to third man
good length, straight, 137kph and defended to cover
and another one past the edge, on a good length outside off, Stoinis tries to get forward. Skims past the bat
round the wicket, driven on the up square of the wicket through point out to the sweeper
full, slips down the leg side, neatly flicked down to fine leg...a rare poor delivery
full outside off, driven to cover
back of a length on off stump, defended
angled down the leg side, another wide
width outside off, carved through point and good running makes it a second
oh dear! What was that?! Stoinis has just clubbed it to mid-on. A length ball, he tried to drive through the line, didn't even look as though he was trying to keep it down. Simple catch
goes down for a paddle sweep, neatly played through short fine leg, almost makes the boundary but Ngidi gets a boot on it
goes back to a length ball that skids on, knocks it into the leg side
a drag down from Tahir, pulled through square leg
short of a length, slides on to the right hander, pushed to mid-on
he's been too short so far, this is outside off, Cummins rocks back and drives square through point
this is fuller outside off, Carey tried a big slog sweep but doesn't make contact
full outside off, driven to deep cover
round the wicket, back of a length, defended to backward point
gets this fuller outside off and beats the edge as Carey lunges forward
seam movement on this one, nips back at Carey, beats the inside edge and rebounds off the pads to the off side
full outside off, comes forward and pushes into midwicket...good running
short of a length outside off, defended to cover
very full, flicked into midwicket
a short one, pulled behind square to the man in the deep
full outside off, prods forward and defends
on off stump, played to short cover
a touch shorter this time, Cummins waits on the back foot and defends
pushed fuller outside off, angled square towards point and they scamper a quick single
short of a length outside off, left alone and carries at waist height to de Kock
fuller outside off, 139kph, lovely shape away from the right hander and Cummins makes a late decision to leave
straighter, on a good length, pushed into midwicket
full on the pads, clipped through midwicket, neatly worked away
stays over the wicket to Carey, full outside off, pushed out to deep cover
back of a length outside off, left alone
connects very cleanly with the slog sweep, sends it out to deep midwicket
big appeal for lbw as Carey misses a reverse sweep this time. South Africa review. Did it pitch outside leg? Or has he got a bottom edge on it? Yep, that's come off the bat. Not a great review
a conventional sweep this time, taken from leg stump to short fine leg
full at the stumps, bunted back to the bowler
short of a length, he goes back in the crease and works to midwicket
tries to tuck this off the pads but it just dribbles to short fine leg
a short ball outside off, 141kph, Cummins sways out of the line
back of a length at off stump, finds the outside edge but it's quickly to ground on the way to second slip...up at 142kph
touch fuller outside off, 138kph, shaping away and a well-judged leave
a bouncer over middle and leg, he ducks
back of a length outside off, Cummins shoulders arms and de Kock takes it above his head
on off stump, back of a length, 139kph, Cummins adjusts to the movement and angles it through backward point
full at off stump, a legspinner, strides forward and defends
tight to the stumps, blocked on the front foot
full and straight, played to short, straight cover
this squeezes off the outside edge as he plays forward and runs through third man
touch slower through the air, full outside off, brings him forward and plays to backward point
fuller, driven back to the bowler
over the wicket, angled across outside off and left alone
short of a length, straight, dropped into the off side

direct hit from cover! David Miller on target, an underarm flick with his right hand. Cummins is struggling. Was dropped into the off side by Carey, Cummins was slow out of the blocks and he's well short. There has been some wonderful bowling today, but Australia also not helping themselves
what a delivery to get first up! Short of a length outside off, climbs past the bat as Coulter-Niles arches out of the line
back cut down to third man, NCN batted well in the recent T20 series in UAE
full at the stumps, defended back down the pitch
short of a length, slides on straight, pushed to midwicket
slower outside off, he comes forward and it comes off the outside edge down through third man
plays back to a shorter ball and pushes to Tahir
very full outside off and that's hammered through the covers, whistles along the carpet...one of the best shots today (small sample size)
drags the length back, defended to cover
nearly cleans him up, skims past the outside edge and was very close to both the edge and off stump
round the wicket, length ball outside off, left alone
a straighter delivery, tucked into the leg side and mid-on can't prevent the single
top shot, NCN pulls out another gem, this time it's a full delivery at the stumps which he drills straight down the ground
fantastic response from Rabada, back of a length at off stump, completely squares up Coulter-Nile who is beaten
and that's a wild swing against a full ball outside off, aiming to reach the green in one shot. Doesn't connect
that's better, full outside off, left alone
round the wicket, just short of a good length, defended
some innovation from Carey, brings out the reverse sweep and places it perfectly between short third man and backward point
and now a normal sweep against a very full delivery, finds short fine leg
this time the sweep does beat short fine leg, he chances a second run and has to bring the dive out to make his ground

another sweep, and he's gone. He couldn't stop himself sweeping and paddling. Was trying to almost scoop this right over the keeper. Takes a little top edge, into the arm, and lobs up the air. De Kock takes a simple catch. Poor game management from Carey?
the google slides past the outside edge as Starc reaches out for a first-ball drive
good ball, good length at off stump, takes the outside edge but well short of third slip
almost knocked off his feet by this one, manages to force it through midwicket
take that! NCN strikes through the line of a length ball and sends it well over mid-off
full at the stumps, has to be quick to get the bat down and keeps it out towards mid-on
takes his bottom hand off the bat as he shovels this into square leg
good strike from Starc, drills a full delivery straight down the ground...was in the air for a while, but very safe
beaten by a nice leg break, playing from the crease and defending
slider, he's back and defending into the off side
misses trying to sweep a really full ball outside off
slashed to third man! He shapes to sweep but it's a full toss wide of off, so he changes the shot and slashes off the edge to third man
outside off, he pushes gently to cover
wrong un on middle and he turns this to midwicket
122kph, well wide of off, back of a length, he leaves this alone
126kph, angled way down leg for a wide
shorter length, off stump line, he defends with the full face from the crease
lofts this up and over mid off, it's mistimed off the toe, it just carries the man running back and they get an easy two
127kph, beaten sparring at a very wide one, it did nip away off the seam but it was miles away from off
123kph, shorter length into leg stump, clipped away off the hip to deep square leg

Pulled for six! It just cleared the man on the rope! This was banged in short, head high, he crushed this pull shot flat and hard, it looked for a moment he might have picked out Rabada on the rope but it kept going and cleared him!
pushed through flatter, he's back and pushing to mid off
tossed up, off stump, he nudges to cover and Klaasen misfields and it allows one
off the pad, it runs fine down leg side, Steyn chases it down and hauls it in just short of the rope
around the wicket, tossed up, full, he drives hard back to the bowler
slog sweep from outside off, dragged it behind square! This wasn't nailed, but it was placed and controlled well enough and well behind square to the vacant rope

Given LBW! Starc reviews. This was pushed through flatter, out of the front of the hand and it skids on, he was right back in his crease and struck on the knee roll. Nothing on hot spot. Nothing on snicko. He missed it. Hawkeye has it pitching in line and hitting. Out! Good decision.
Pulled for four along the ground! This was a short ball, chest high, he swivels and rolls the wrists and nails it again behind square and the sweeper stands no chance of cutting it off
short outside off, he late cuts to third man and takes the one. Happy to take every run on offer
ramped up over slip! What a shot first ball! This was banged in from around the wicket, he sways back, upper cuts it casually over slips head, two bounces for four. Superb!
back of a length, off stump line, he defends from the crease
shorter into the hip, 130kph, he turns to square leg along the ground
133kph, fuller on middle, turned with the angle into midwicket. 150 is up to huge cheers from the crowd
93kph, pushed through flat, he defends with an open face to backward point
flipper, on off, he defends on the front foot
84kph, tossed up, he drives nicely to long off
flipper, pushed through outside off, its shorter and he tries to cut and is beaten for pace
tossed up, full and he blocks, smothering the spin
tossed up, he tries to smash this down the ground, gets a thick inside edge to short fine leg and they take one

Skied pull shot and Klaasen sits under it and takes it easily at mid on! The end for Australia. It was short and wide of off, but he tried to pull over midwicket, got it off the toe end of the bat, it flew very high, Klaasen camped under it and took an easy catch
fuller length outside off, he drives to mid off
141kph, short on the hip, he turns this behind square
142kph, fourth stump line, good length, he leaves this outside off
144kph, beaten by a beauty, fourth stump line, back of a length, he shuffles across the crease trying to defend and it flies past the edge
142kph, back of a length, nipping back, hits the inside edge and onto the body, it drops safely on the off side
142kph, good length well wide of off, he leaves this alone through to the keeper
135kph, good length swinging back in to the left hander, he's forward and pushing firmly to mid on
138kph, half volley on leg and he clips this beautifully wide of mid on! Lovely timing
again swinging into the pads, 138kph, he glances this away behind square and fine leg comes around
sumptuous drive on the up past mid off! Supreme stroke from de Kock. This was wide but not a half volley and he leans into it and places it wide of mid off and it races away
short and wide, cut hard and Maxwell makes a diving stop knocking it down, they get one but he saved a boundary
five wides fired way down leg! This was a poor delivery and it pitched just short of Carey and he couldn't glove it and it races to the rope
half volley driven very hard but straight to cover
another superb cover drive! This was floated up outside off and he climbs into a drive crunching it wide of cover and it races away
too straight, down leg, tucked fine! The overcorrection from Hazlewood is taxed. It was into the hip and he turned this fine with ease for four
144kph, good length, across him and he edges well short of second slip
141kph, good length, off stump, he defends on the front foot
140kph, beats him with one that nips away off the good length outside off
shorter length, well wide of off and going away, he raises the bat above his head and lets it go
145kph, fullish length outside off, not much swing back, he pushes firmly to cover
141kph, good length well wide of off, he leaves, it stays a touch low and bounces before it gets to Carey
143kph, back of a length and some lift and bounce, he leaves, and this flies through head height to the keeper
140kph, climbs off a length outside off, he cuts and slices it of off the top edge wide of third man and it lands very safely
144kph, back of a length, squares him up in defence, gets a thick outside edge along the ground through the vacant gully to third man
144kph, this rears off a length, it took off! He tried to drive on the up and it flew way over the edge and to the keeper above his head!
141kph, fifth stump line, good length, he leaves comfortably outside off
137kph, back of a length outside off, coming back off the seam but he leaves on length and it goes through to the keeper
136kph, short ball wide of off, he's quick to sway under it and let it pass harmlessly by
142kph, well wide of off, tempting full length but Hendricks has no interest in playing at it
137kph, half-volley, driven inside out to backward point but straight to Maxwell
139kph, full on off, he drives firmly straight to mid off
and he's driving nicely again, strides forward into a full one outside off, places it between cover and mid-off
pulls the length back, outside off, left alone
angled into the pads, flicked in front of square for another brace
big appeal for lbw as de Kock flicks across the line of a full delivery, but was it angling down leg side? Yeah, missing leg
driven into the off side for a sharp single
another strong drive, this time from Hendricks as he comes forward and drives square through point...big chase and flick back by Maxwell saves a run
it's a driving range at the moment, full outside off, comes forward and places it sweetly wide of mid-off
an aborted appeal for lbw because this pitched well outside leg, de Kock aiming to work through the on side
full on the stumps, driven firmly to mid-off
flamboyance from de Kock! On the pads and he picks it up over the leg side, strong use of the wrists, dispatches it towards deep square leg
poor line again, fuller but still on the pads, flicked wide of mid-on as the score rattles along
full outside off, not quite off the middle as he plays forward, squirts off a thick inside edge towards square leg
short of a length on off stump, 146kph, defended to the covers
short, at the body, defended off the splice of the bat to the off side
angled across outside off, left alone
cracking shot! That's a beauty from Hendricks as he crashes a full delivery, outside off, on the up through the covers. A candidate for shot of the day
he pulls the length back, on off stump, defended
gets another one through the off side, a more punchy drive this time, no quite so pleasing on the eye but the result is the same as he scoots wide of mid-off
round the wicket, short of a length outside off, chopped through backward point, wide of third man
angled in from round the wicket, short of a length, takes the thigh pad
extra bounce as this jumps from short of a length, hammers into his bottom hand
back of a length at off stump, defended to the on side of the stumps
worked off the pads behind square on the leg side
short outside off, drops it towards backward point
full at off stump, defended
tucked into the leg side
good length at off stump, 143kph, defended on the front foot
well bowled, a length ball nips back and takes the inside edge...nearly cuts him in half
back of a length, straight, good wheels at 146kph, worked into midwicket
well bowled, good length outside off, Hendricks hanging back a little and is comprehensively beaten
that's a wild drive outside off, aiming on the up, the ball flies over the top edge
square drives into the covers, good diving save by Head but they are able to complete the single
short of a length outside off, driven from the back foot to mid-off
very wide outside off, Hendricks chases it and gets the wide call
that's a good 'un, banged in short at the body, he jumps to defend, comes off the splice
another back-foot drive, short-of-a-length delivery, goes in the air for quite a while but wide of mid-off
goes for the yorker, it's on target with just a hint of shape, runs off the face down to third man
back of a length, defended to the on side
beaten by a full one outside off, Hendricks is just hanging a little leg side of the ball
a bouncer outside off, 144kph, he sways out of the line
full and straight, defended back past a diving Cummins in his followthrough
good length at off stump, 144kph, defended
this angles back into Hendricks, beats the inside edge and strikes him a rather painful blow on the leg
that's a well-directed bouncer, de Kock is in two minds whether to pull or leave it alone, ends up flapping into midwicket
back of a length at middle, 142kph, defended to backward point off the outer part of the bat
plays over the top of a very full delivery outside off, bursts through Carey's gloves
short of a length, flicked off his hip into square leg
through the off side again, very full outside off, doesn't quite have the legs to reach the rope this time
aims to square drive this away, but it's a little close to him and he's cramped for room. Beats the top edge
nasty blow, brute of a ball! Short of a length, jumps wildly at Hendricks and goes between his bat and gloves into the shoulder
good length, straight, solidly behind the line the ball after that nasty delivery
sharp bouncer! Cummins is going through the gears, a bouncer which zips over his head
excellent batting, he's been given a bit of a working over from Cummins but he neatly punches this off the back foot through the covers
short of a length outside off, a whip-pull sends it through midwicket
full outside off, punched into the covers
round the wicket, full outside off, driven sweetly to mid-off
drives this in the air, square towards point, but it falls short of Maxwell
flashed over the slips as he goes after a short ball, threw everything at it, gets a big top edge that flies down to third man
angled into the pads, beats midwicket
well bowled, spears in the toe-crusher from round the wicket but Hendricks is able to dig it out
dismissive! Fetch that says Hendricks, a short ball outside off which he pulls with real power wide of mid-on
works a length ball into the on side
back of a length at off stump, 143kph, defended to the covers
he's driven nicely and this is another one, between cover and mid-off
beats the outside with one that holds its line, doesn't carry on the full to Carey
defends a length ball into the covers
finds the outside edge, think Hendricks was trying to pull his bat away, flies well wide of the lone slip
full, wide with his first ball back but the drive picks out cover
takes another blow from a short one as he isn't able to sway out of the line, comes off his arm, I think, and deflects past slip
another big leg-side flick, angled into the pads, he deliberately goes in the air and gets it between deep square and long leg

A breakthrough! De Kock looking to finish the game quickly, aiming to loft straight down the ground, comes from low down on the bat and goes very high, but without much distance. Mid-off settles underneath it
138kph, back of a length outside off, he defends off the back foot to point
137kph, fuller length, fourth stump line, he drives to cover but can't beat the man diving to his left
141kph, good length at off stump, he's covering up solidly in defence
141kph, short outside off, he shapes to cut but it stays a touch low and shoots under the bat through to the keeper!
good length, off stump line, he stands up and defends to mid on
142kph, good length off stump, he gets this off the inside half of the bat defending at it rund through forward square and they sprint back for two

caught behind off the glove down leg! Given out! Markram reviews immediately. This was short down leg, he tried to pull and got cramped, it went through to Carey and Australians were convinced. Hot spot and snicko have proved conclusively he missed it! Aleem Dar has to change his decision. Not out!
back of a length on off, he defends into the off side
shorter length, 140kph, he is jumping and defending to midwicket
137kph back of a length, off stump line, he defends off the back foot to cover-point
fuller outside off, he drives hard to mid off
short and wide of off, punched off the back foot past backward point and it forces a chase for Maxwell
back of a length, off stump, he defends with the full face to cover
138kph, cross seam, back of a length, fourth stump, he pushes firmly off the back foot to cover
square drives and on the up, nice strike past point, it wasn't timed perfectly and Maxwell pulls it in centimetres from the rope!
edged and just short and wide of second slip! It was the perfect length, squared him up, he edged down short of the diving Finch and it runs to third man
good length, off stump, he defends neatly to cover
141kph, he stands tall and plays a glorious back foot drive, cracks it past cover and again the Australians have a long chase to haul it in just short of the rope
141kph, fifth stump line, he's up on his toes defending with soft hands dropping it at his feet
short on the hip and pulled to fine leg
144kph, back of a length, off stump, he defends off the back foot to midwicket
131kph, short outside off, he cuts nicely past backward point and they run well to get two on the arm from third man
magnificent cover-drive! This was a half-volley and Markram hammered it through the covers with ease and immense power
good length, off stump, he defends comfortably off the front foot
131kph, wide of the crease angled at off stump, he defends from a good length back to mid off
another glorious square drive this time! This was not a half volley, but wide, and on the up he thrashes this forward of point on the front foot

cracking pull shot this time! Markram is rolling now. This was short outside off, he was back and swivelling on a pull, he didn't nail it, forward square was diving to his right and had half a chance but it was wide of the hand and raced to the rope
128kph, full and angled way down leg, he missed out trying to clip to leg and it runs off the pad
133kph, good length on off, he's defending on the front foot to cover
132kph, good length on middle, he defends on the front foot to midwicket
131kph, back of a length outside off, he pushes off the back foot to cover-point
134kph, back of a length, nipping back, it hits him on the thigh and doubles him over a touch

caught at mid on! A bizarre dismissal. It was a good length, he tried to launch down the ground, it bounced a touch and got him a bit quicker, it hit the splice of the bat and ballooned up to mid on and Lynn waltzed around to take a very easy catch.
135kph, short on off, he's back nicely on his toes and tucking this forward of square to the gap
139kph, good length outside off, fifth stump, he leaves it easily
135kph, fifth stump line, good length, he leaves alone again
136kph, wide of the crease, good length, angled into off, he defends on the front foot to cover
back of a length, wide of off again, he leaves once more
136kph, fuller and closer to off, he drives firmly back to the bowler
133kph, full on off, he pushes firmly on the front foot to mid on
134kph, full length, outside off, driven very firmly back to the bowler. That was crunched
134kph, angled to middle and leg, clipped nicely wide of mid on and a misfield from Lynn! Oh no! He should've cut this off but didn't get down and it ran away
short ball, pulled very high to deep square leg but there's no one out there and it falls safely
133kph, good length wide of off, run neatly down to third man
132kph, back of a length, he stands up and punches to cover
gloves an attempted pull fine past the keeper! This was short on the hip and it got onto him quickly, his pull came off the gloves but went wide of the keeper and fine to the fence
back of a length outside off, he mistimes a punch off the back foot to cover
137kph, back of a length on off, he defends off the back foot
135kph, short onto the hip, it comes off the thigh pad and falls into the leg side and they pinch one
132kph, good length outside off, he defends into the vacant gully and they run one
136kph, back of a length outside off, he punches off the back foot to backward point
131kph, good length, off stump, he check drives firmly to mid off
126kph, back of a length, fifth stump, he tries to force off the back foot, he mistimes and drags it to mid on
134kph, good length, this spits off a length and hits the bat high on the splice, du Plessis rips his bottom hand of the bat
130kph, angled into middle and off, he turns this with the angle to mid on
134kph, half-volley outside off, he drives with a lot of bottom hand wide of mid off and goes with it as the fielder dives to his left

chipped nicely up and over midwicket! This was angled into leg stump, he just lifted this with the bottom hand up and over the man at catching midwicket, he times it perfectly, cleared the man and it runs away
137kph, middle stump, back of a length, he defends with the full face back to the bowler
136kph, fuller length outside off, he drives neatly between cover and mid off for a couple
139kph, hint of shape into the right hander, he turns this to midwicket but can't beat the fielder
137kph, wide half volley, he drives but mis times straight to cover
136kph, yorker length, he drops the bat down and squeezer it out to backward point
139kph, short and lifting across him, he sways underneath it comfortably and lets it pass to the keeper
131kph, back of a length, off stump, he defends into the gully and they think about one but decide against it

chopped on! He is annoyed at this. It was short and wide, he tried to play a cut but it stayed a touch lower and held up, he got an inside edge and dragged it back onto the stumps. Markram was furious
134kph, very full outside off, he drives with an open blade to backward point
short ball, outside off, he rides the bounce and runs this with control down to third man
125kph, back of a length outside off, he punches off the back foot wide of mid off
132kph, full on off, driven firmly to mid on but he can't beat the man
139kph, good length outside off, he drives on the up past cover, times this OK and they get a couple
138kph, good length, way wide of off, and he lets it go
139kph, full on off, he drives to mid off but it wasn't well timed and straight to the man
124kph, slower ball, on middle and off, he defends on middle and off, into the leg side
140kph, short and wide and cut away forward of point, to the big boundary, and they run an easy three
full outside off, squeezed out past backward point

edged at caught at first slip! Well bowled by Stoinis. A good length ball, just outside off, he tries to drive on the up with no footwork, it bounces a little, catches the edge and flies to Finch at first slip who catches it infront of his eyes. Three for Stoinis
full on leg stump clipped off the toes wide of fine leg and there's the win
